ai-iti41:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti41:2.1_0: “Mendicants, sentient beings are inferior to bereft of noble wisdom.
ai-iti41:2.2_0: They live unhappily in the present life—with distress, anguish, and fever—
ai-iti41:2.3_0: and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.
ai-iti41:2.4_0: Those sentient beings are not bereft who are not bereft of noble wisdom.
ai-iti41:2.5_0: In the present life they’re happy—free of anguish, distress, and fever—
ai-iti41:2.6_0: and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.”
ai-iti41:2.7_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-iti41:3.2_0: Just so the world with its gods,
ai-iti41:4.1_0: Wisdom is best in the world,
ai-iti41:4.4_0: the ending of rebirth and continued existence.
ai-iti41:5.2_0: are envied by even the gods.
ai-iti41:6.1_0: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
